newsitem.title: UK: ATHLETICS-BRITISH BOARD ASK FOR $5 MILLION FROM LOTTERY.
newsitem.headline: ATHLETICS-BRITISH BOARD ASK FOR $5 MILLION FROM LOTTERY.

text.p: The British Athletic Federation (BAF) has asked for an annual sum of up to five million pounds sterling ($8.3 million) from the national lottery.
British chief coach Malcolm Arnold said on Tuesday the federation had presented a submission to the Sports Council.
"We are talking about four to five million a year," he said.
If successful, the BAF will institute a development plan which will increase the number of professional coaches from 10 to 34.

The BAF has endured a troubled 12 months, clashing with former world champions Linford Christie and Colin Jackson over appearance money last year and losing its fourth chief executive in 12 months on Saturday when former world 200 metres record holder Peter Radford unexpectedly resigned.
